com.foreach.across.modules.codes.utils

Class CodeGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.codes.utils.CodeGenerator

  • public class CodeGenerator
extends Object
    Generator that creates unique codes using an underlying MappedStringEncoder. Codes are first generated as random numbers that are uniformly distributed across the possible number range. The numbers are subsequently encoded to strings using the encoder. Use forCodeLength(int) to create a code generator with a default MappedStringEncoder.

    The length of the code as well as the number of codes generated will determine the statistical probability of guessing a code.

    Note that there is no uniqueness of codes between calls to the generator.

    Author:
    Arne Vandamme
    See Also:
    forCodeLength(int)

        public Iterator<String> generate(int numberOfCodes)
        Generates a number of random codes that are all the same - full - length.

        Returns:
        List of codes.

        Generates a number of random codes.
        Parameters:
